com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.reports.hardware_compatibility.storage_device_overrides

Interface VcgEntries

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, VcgEntriesTypes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VcgEntriesStub

    public interface VcgEntries
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, VcgEntriesTypes
    This interface provides methods to manage VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG) product overrides for storage devices in a cluster. This interface was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.1.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.reports.hardware_compatibility.storage_device_overrides.VcgEntriesTypes

        VcgEntriesTypes._VAPI_OPERATIONS, VcgEntriesTypes.Key, VcgEntriesTypes.ProductSelectionSpec, VcgEntriesTypes.UpdateSpec

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.reports.hardware_compatibility.storage_device_overrides.VcgEntriesTypes

        _VAPI_SERVICE_ID

    • Method Detail

      • update_Task

        java.lang.String update_Task(java.lang.String cluster,
                             VcgEntriesTypes.UpdateSpec updateSpec)
        Updates the storage device VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG) product overrides for a cluster. This method also updates the existing CheckResult if any, based on the additional information provided by the vcg product overrides for the devices. The storage device categorization based on the compliance status from the last check result will remain the same until a com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.reports.HardwareCompatibility#check method is invoked. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.1.

        Synchronous method overload. Result of the invocation is a task identifier which will be returned by this method.

        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        updateSpec - Specification for updating the compatibility overrides for the cluster.
        Returns:
        identifier for the task created by this API invocation
        Throws:
        Error - if there is an unknown error. The accompanying error message will give more details about the failure.
        NotFound - if there is no cluster associated with the cluster
        InvalidArgument - if one of the values in the update specification is invalid.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

      • update_Task

        java.lang.String update_Task(java.lang.String cluster,
                             VcgEntriesTypes.UpdateSpec updateSpec,
                             com.vmware.vapi.bindings.client.InvocationConfig invocationConfig)
        Updates the storage device VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG) product overrides for a cluster. This method also updates the existing CheckResult if any, based on the additional information provided by the vcg product overrides for the devices. The storage device categorization based on the compliance status from the last check result will remain the same until a com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.reports.HardwareCompatibility#check method is invoked. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.1.

        Synchronous method overload. Result of the invocation is a task identifier which will be returned by this method. Use invocationConfig to specify configuration for this particular invocation.

        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        updateSpec - Specification for updating the compatibility overrides for the cluster.
        invocationConfig - Configuration for the method invocation.
        Returns:
        identifier for the task created by this API invocation
        Throws:
        Error - if there is an unknown error. The accompanying error message will give more details about the failure.
        NotFound - if there is no cluster associated with the cluster
        InvalidArgument - if one of the values in the update specification is invalid.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

      • update_Task

        void update_Task(java.lang.String cluster,
                 VcgEntriesTypes.UpdateSpec updateSpec,
                 com.vmware.vapi.bindings.client.AsyncCallback<java.lang.String> asyncCallback)
        Updates the storage device VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG) product overrides for a cluster. This method also updates the existing CheckResult if any, based on the additional information provided by the vcg product overrides for the devices. The storage device categorization based on the compliance status from the last check result will remain the same until a com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.reports.HardwareCompatibility#check method is invoked. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.1.

        Asynchronous method overload. Result of the invocation which is a task identifier will be reported via the specified asyncCallback.

        Invocation Result:
        identifier for the task created by this API invocation

        Operation Errors:
        Error - if there is an unknown error. The accompanying error message will give more details about the failure.
        NotFound - if there is no cluster associated with the cluster
        InvalidArgument - if one of the values in the update specification is invalid.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        updateSpec - Specification for updating the compatibility overrides for the cluster.
        asyncCallback - Receives the status (progress, result or error) of the operation invocation.
